definition: to do a blood test/to have one's blood tested

sentences.english: An avian veterinarian can perform a blood test to measure your African grey's calcium levels.
sentences.chinese: 兽医可以用验血来衡量你灰鹦的钙水平。

sentences.english: without a doubt you have hepatitis--the blood test proves it.
sentences.chinese: 你无疑是患了肝炎，验血证实了这一点。

sentences.english: Blood tests can detect yellow fever antibodies produced in response to the infection.
sentences.chinese: 验血可检测出因感染产生的黄热病抗体。

sentences.english: A quick blood test can assess your level of thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH).
sentences.chinese: 验血就能显示你促甲状腺激素的指数。

sentences.english: Rainy this day, I would like to go to the hospital blood test.
sentences.chinese: 这样的冷雨天，我还要去医院验血。

sentences.english: Today i went to Queen Elizebath Hospital to get my blooding exam result.
sentences.chinese: 今天去了伊利莎白女王医院去拿我的验血结果。

sentences.english: No. For the blood test, they cut my finger.
sentences.chinese: 不，验血他们要用针扎我的手指头。

sentences.english: What to need to diagnose Oh , treat, do not collect the blood test fee right away being able to?
sentences.chinese: 需要什么诊断啊，治疗，不就收验血费就可以了吗？

sentences.english: Your doctor may arrange blood tests or send you to a rheumatologist.
sentences.chinese: 你的医生可能安排验血或发送给您风湿病。

sentences.english: Early diagnosis can be accomplished through relatively inexpensive blood testing.
sentences.chinese: 可以通过相对价廉的验血进行早期诊断。

definition: to take blood/to draw blood (e.g. for a test)
chemical examination/to do a lab test
biopsy/abbr. for 活體組織檢查|活体组织检查[huo2 ti3 zu3 zhi1 jian3 cha2]
abbr. for 產前檢查|产前检查[chan3 qian2 jian3 cha2]
hemogram/picture of blood used in medical research
abbr. for 體格檢查|体格检查[ti3 ge2 jian3 cha2]
to give or have an injection
